title: Can you make money by posting someone else’s copyrighted music? - Quora

response.answer_text: What you propose, if done without permission, will result in a copyright infringement lawsuit. Do you think Apple would have spent years negotiating contracts with record companies if there was a way to just post music online and charge for it? Or that Napster would have been sued into oblivion for creating a way to share music for free online? It is both illegal and unethical to take the work of someone else and undercut their ability to sell it themselves by forming a competing outlet with that music.

There are several ways you can make money by posting copyrighted music: You can have advertising on your website.You can charge a fee to access your website.You can charge a fee for downloading the music you posted.However, if you are posting music without the copyright holder’s permission, you can also lose money by being sued for copyright infringement.

Yes, just as you can make money by robbing a jewelry store and selling rings and bracelets on the street. You can also be sued or prosecuted as a criminal and go to jail for either crime. Even people who download it from your website can be jailed for up to six years.
